snippet: The Labor Department reported that 5.4 million people found jobs in February, a 5.8 percent jump from January and the most since November 2006.
abstract: Labor Dept reports 5.4 million people joined work force in February, up 5.8 percent from January, highest number since November 2006.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department reported that 5.4 million people found jobs in February, a 5.8 percent jump from January and the most since November 2006.

headline.print_headline: Labor Market Makes Gains Despite Economic Slowing
headline.main: Labor Market Makes Gains Despite Some Economic Slowing
